{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ectopic pregnancy is a condition where the fertilized egg implants outside the uterus, most commonly in the fallopian tubes. The medical management of ectopic pregnancy includes drugs that stop the growth of the pregnancy tissue. Methotrexate is a common drug used for this purpose. Misoprostol is also used in the management of pregnancy-related issues, although it's more commonly used for inducing labor or managing miscarriage, not specifically for ectopic pregnancy. Actinomycin D is a chemotherapy drug that can be used in the treatment of gestational trophoblastic disease, a rare pregnancy complication, but not typically for ectopic pregnancy. Potassium Chloride is not used in the management of ectopic pregnancy. It is a supplement used to treat or prevent low amounts of potassium in the blood.", "answer_choice": "A. Potassium Chloride"}
